title: Rockets soar by Dubs late, head home for Game 7
content: Fred VanVleet had 29 points, 8 assists and 8 rebounds, Alperen Sengun contributed 21 points and 14 rebounds, and the Rockets kept their season alive by beating the Warriors 115-107 on Friday night to force a Game 7.

title: Pop done coaching Spurs; Johnson takes over
content: Gregg Popovich is moving to a full-time role in the Spurs' front office, and Mitch Johnson will take over head coaching duties, the team announced Friday.

title: Tigers' Greene homers twice in 9th in MLB first
content: Riley Greene homered to open the top of the ninth inning and capped an eight-run outburst with a three-run shot to lead the Tigers to a 9-1 win over the Angels on Friday night.

title: Jets stick up for Hellebuyck after latest playoff dud
content: Jets star goaltender Connor Hellebuyck failed to finish his third straight game after allowing five goals on 23 shots in Friday's Game 6 loss in St. Louis.

title: Romero disrupts Garcia's plans in massive upset
content: Ryan Garcia's plans for a second showdown with Devin Haney took a massive hit Friday night, when Rolly Romero pulled off an upset in a unanimous decision.

title: Simms' No. 11 to stay retired amid Carter search
content: Phil Simms told longtime New York Daily News writer Gary Myers on Friday that he was "outvoted by his family" and his No. 11 will remain retired by the Giants and won't go to Abdul Carter.

title: Sky's Reese stars vs. Brazil in LSU homecoming
content: Angel Reese had 15 points and 10 rebounds, helping the Sky to a rousing 89-62 exhibition victory over the Brazilian national team on Friday night in her return to LSU.

title: Red Sox's Casas suffers 'significant' knee injury
content: Red Sox first baseman Triston Casas suffered what manager Alex Cora called a "significant" knee injury after he awkwardly fell near first base in the bottom of the second inning against the Minnesota Twins on Friday night.

title: üèà Inside the decision to draft Shedeur Sanders
content: Cleveland didn't have Sanders graded as an elite prospect, but saw him as a steal once he slid to Day 3.

title: What this monumental coaching change means for San Antonio
content: What's next for San Antonio after Pop's move to the front office? What does Mitch Johnson bring? Our NBA insiders break down the news.

title: Handing out April grades for all 30 MLB teams: From many A's to a surprising F
content: Is your favorite team acing -- or flunking -- the early part of the 2025 season? We break it all down.

title: An early ranking of Rookie of the Year contenders: Two lists, 34 draft picks
content: Cam Ward, Ashton Jeanty or the field for OROY? Abdul Carter for DROY? And how does Travis Hunter factor in?

title: What the Lakers' early exit tells us about their future with Luka
content: In nearly every way, the Lakers were outclassed by the Wolves. And now, after a disappointingly early exit, their next task is even more important: selling Doncic that this first-round loss was merely an aberration.

title: Diggins 'changed our program': How Notre Dame became the pipeline for some of the WNBA's top guards
content: Eight Notre Dame guards, including 2013 draft pick Skylar Diggins, are expected to make 2025 WNBA rosters.

title: How Wrexham paid their way to promotion, and why the Premier League requires more than that
content: Wrexham's promotion might look miraculous, but it's actually a combination of factors that other Premier League hopefuls shouldn't try to replicate.

title: NBA draft asset rankings: Where OKC's treasure trove and all 30 teams check in
content: Who controls the 2025 NBA draft? What about the next seven? Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo examine every team's draft future.

title: Luck Index 2025: Who needs luck on their side next season?
content: Turnover luck, coordinator upgrade, transfer portal haul? They all could lead to some upswings for a select few teams.

title: 'We've got the identity that fits us': Wisconsin turns back the clock to move forward
content: Wisconsin coach Luke Fickell is going back to the Badgers' roots in a crucial Year 3 for his program.

title: Exiting De Bruyne: 'Shown I can still play here'
content: Kevin De Bruyne said he proved he "can still play here" after the departing Manchester City midfielder scored a vital winning goal in his team's quest to qualify for next season's Champions League.

title: Slot reveals Klopp message after Prem title win
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has revealed his predecessor J√ºrgen Klopp reached out to congratulate him after his team won the Premier League title.

title: Madrid or Leverkusen? Alonso says 'we must wait'
content: Bayer Leverkusen coach Xabi Alonso said we must wait until the end of the season for an announcement on his future amid links to Real Madrid.

title: Conte: McTominay better now than at Man United
content: Napoli manager Antonio Conte said Scott McTominay has become a more complete and knowledgeable player since joining from Manchester United last summer.

title: Paris FC join PSG in Ligue 1 for 1st time in 46 yrs
content: Paris FC will be back in action in the French top flight next season following an absence of 46 years after they secured promotion to Ligue 1 on Friday following a 1-1 draw at Martigues.

title: Wrexham boss: 'Legends' Mullin, Palmer to stay
content: Wrexham boss Phil Parkinson has confirmed that "legends" Paul Mullin and Ollie Palmer remain a part of the club's plans for next season.

title: Mascherano: Miami 'clearly Messi-dependent'
content: Inter Miami coach Javier Mascherano laughed off suggestions his team was too dependent upon Lionel Messi and insisted they will bounce back stronger when they host New York Red Bulls in MLS action following a tough CCL elimination.

title: Flick on Yamal: Hard work to top Messi, Ronaldo
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said on Friday that Lamine Yamal must work hard and continue to replicate his Inter Milan performance to reach the level of Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.

title: In its spell as F1 host, Miami has become America's Monaco
content: A good F1 venue goes beyond on-track action, and when it comes to spectacle and fun, Miami is second to none.

title: Will a serious focus on health bring horse racing fans back?
content: The Horseracing Integrity and Safety Authority (HISA) has a plan to keep the industry healthy with increased regulations. Will it work?

title: Betting the 151st Kentucky Derby: What you need to know to make a smart race wager
content: The basics and insider intel you need to sound smart while betting the most exciting two minutes in sports.

title: Relevent-USSF settlement: Are foreign leagues coming to America?
content: Settling its suit against U.S. Soccer, Relevent can now bring foreign games to the U.S. Is MLS under threat?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid want Alexander-Arnold before Liverpool deal ends
content: Real Madrid want to sign TAA for the Club World Cup before his Liverpool contract ends. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Which NFL teams already need a QB for 2026? Reid‚Äôs first-round mock draft has four in the top 10
content: Four QBs in the top 10? Two big trades? Let's make way-too-early predictions for every pick of next year's first round.

title: Rating the rookies for 2025 and beyond
content: Matt Bowen provides his analysis of this year's rookie class in fantasy, in terms of redraft and dynasty value.

title: Draft tiers at guard
content: Eric Moody goes through the different tiers at the guard position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Pahalgam fallout: Fearing India hit, Pak empties out terror launch pads off LoC
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir, intelligence reports indicate that numerous Pakistani terrorists have retreated from the launchpads in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK) to deeper locations within POK and Pakistan. This withdrawal comes amid fears of retaliatory strikes by the Indian forces, reminiscent of the 2019 surgical strikes.

title: 6 killed in Goa: How did the temple stampede occur?
content: A tragic stampede at the Lairai Devi temple in Goa during the Shree Devi Lairai jatra has resulted in the death of at least six people and injuries to over fifteen others. Authorities have initiated an emergency response, with the injured being shifted to nearby hospitals. The cause of the stampede is currently unknown, and investigations are underway as the chief minister assesses the situation.

title: 'Caste census merely first step': Tejashwi writes to PM Modi, bats for private quota
content: Tejashwi Yadav, RJD leader, urged Prime Minister Modi to reconsider the reservation cap after the caste census data is available, emphasizing the need for social justice and proportional representation. He highlighted the potential for the census to reveal significant underrepresentation of OBCs and EBCs, advocating for inclusivity in both political representation and the private sector, which benefits from public resources.

title: Bihar's Saharsa airport runway turns exam centre for 300 job aspirants
content: A viral video reveals students in Saharsa, Bihar, utilizing the airport runway as an exam center due to lack of space at coaching institutes. Despite a Rs 25 crore allocation for airport development under the UDAN scheme, the runway is being used for mock tests and physical training, raising questions about its intended purpose before flight operations commence.

title: From Chepauk to Eden Gardens: Does home advantage even exist in the IPL?
content: While home advantage is significant in many sports, its impact in the IPL is debatable. Factors like familiarity and crowd support are often nullified by diverse team compositions. Despite strong home records of teams like CSK and MI, recent seasons show a decline in home wins, sparking debate about pitch conditions and the extent of home advantage in the league.

title: What Trump Tariffs have done to Chinese shopping sites is similar to what India did in 2020
content: The Trump administration ended duty-free access for low-value shipments from China and Hong Kong, effective May 2, 2025. This closes a loophole used by e-commerce giants and illicit goods traffickers, potentially raising prices for American consumers. The move mirrors India's 2020 crackdown on Chinese 'gift' imports evading taxes.

title: Is it a bird, car or chopper? UP cops clip wings of man‚Äôs ‚Äòjugaad helicopter‚Äô
content: Dinesh Patel from Jaunpur modified his Santro into a 'car-copter' hoping to capitalize on wedding season rentals. However, Pratapgarh police seized the vehicle and issued a Rs 25,000 fine for violating the Motor Vehicles Act. The unauthorized modifications and safety concerns led to the car's impoundment during a vehicle check.

title: Russia strikes Ukraine's Kharkiv with Iranian-made drones, 40 injured
content: A Russian drone strike, utilizing Iranian-made Shahed drones, targeted Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, injuring over 40 people, including an 11-year-old girl. President Zelenskyy condemned the attack on residential areas and civilian infrastructure, emphasizing the lack of military targets. He urged world leaders to bolster Ukraine's air defenses, while a separate Russian strike on Zaporizhzhia wounded over 20.

title: Australia election slangs: From 'donkey voting' to 'corflute' and 'tradies'
content: Following Canada's election, Australia is gearing up for its federal election, pitting Anthony Albanese's Labor Party against Peter Dutton's Liberal-National coalition. Unique to Australian elections are compulsory voting and distinctive slang. Terms like 'donkey voting,' where voters randomly number candidates, 'corflutes,' the ubiquitous campaign posters, and 'stoushes,' referring to conflicts, add color to the political landscape.

title: Zomato 'quietly ends' the food delivery service it started just 4 months back
content: Zomato has quietly removed its 15-minute food delivery service, Quick, from its app after just four months, hinting at a change in its rapid delivery strategy. This follows the shutdown of Zomato Instant in 2023. The company is now focusing on Bistro by Blinkit for quick snack deliveries amid increasing competition, separating it from the main restaurant delivery service.

title: 'Overrepresentation of Western ideas': No Kashmir, Palestine in DU psychology syllabus
content: A proposal for Delhi University's psychology syllabus has sparked controversy after key topics like the Israel-Palestine conflict, Kashmir issue, and dating app-related suicides were allegedly removed. The committee chair cited reasons such as the resolution of the Kashmir issue and the strength of the Indian family system, leading to accusations of political motivation and unwarranted interference in academic decision-making. A panel has been formed to rework the syllabus.

title: US criticizes Germany for labeling AfD 'extremist'
content: Top US officials have criticized Germany's decision to label the AfD as a right-wing extremist entity, with JD Vance likening it to rebuilding the Berlin Wall and Marco Rubio denouncing it as tyranny. Germany's Foreign Ministry defended the move as necessary to protect the constitution and counter right-wing extremism, citing historical lessons.

title: 6 dead, 60 injured in stampede at Lairai Zatra in Goa
content: A tragic stampede at the Shree Lairai Zatra festival in Goa's Shirgao village resulted in the deaths of six people and injuries to at least 30 others. Health officials confirmed the fatalities and reported that several of the injured are in critical condition, requiring specialized treatment at Goa Medical College. The state government has initiated an emergency response, providing medical assistance and closely monitoring the situation as authorities investigate the cause of the incident.

title: Did Donald Trump humiliate Elon Musk in meandering graduation speech
content: During a commencement speech at the University of Alabama, President Trump addressed his relationship with Elon Musk, offering initial praise followed by a veiled jab. These remarks came shortly after Musk's departure from his advisory role at the White House, marking a shift in their dynamic. Trump's comments highlight the complex interplay between tech leaders, government, and strategic media narratives.

title: Pahalgam fallout: India plans drive to starve Pakistan of funds from global agencies
content: India is escalating its efforts against Pakistan, urging international bodies like the IMF to re-evaluate financial aid due to alleged support for terrorism. New Delhi seeks a review of IMF loans, including a recent $1.3 billion climate resilience loan, and is engaging with the World Bank and Asian Development Bank.

title: 'Nobody came to know': Congress' Channi questions surgical strike; BJP hits back
content: Former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi, a Congress MP, ignited a major controversy by questioning the veracity of India's surgical strikes in Pakistan, stating he found no evidence of the military action. The BJP strongly condemned Channi's remarks, accusing him of disrespecting the armed forces and politicizing national security.

title: Shubman Gill opens up on heated umpire exchange: 'There are bound to be ‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Shubman Gill's controversial run-out dismissal sparked a heated exchange with umpires during Gujarat Titans' 38-run victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad. Gill, visibly frustrated with the DRS decision, voiced his emotions after being given out. Despite the drama, GT's dominant batting performance, highlighted by minimal dot balls, propelled them to a crucial win, strengthening their playoff aspirations.

title: Ullu app CEO booked over ‚Äòintimate positions‚Äô on reality show 'House Arrest'
content: Mumbai police filed a case against Ajaz Khan and Rajkumar Pandey for alleged obscene content in their web show, 'House Arrest'. A Bajrang Dal member filed the complaint. The National Commission for Women has summoned Ullu App CEO Vibhu Agarwal and Khan. The show has been removed from the Ullu app.

title: IPL 2025: Will rain play spoilsport in RCB vs CSK in Bengaluru?
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru's crucial IPL 2025 match against Chennai Super Kings faces a rain threat, potentially impacting RCB's top-two aspirations. Bengaluru has experienced incessant rain, with a 70% chance of continued showers on match day. CSK's training was disrupted on Friday, while RCB's session was cut short due to heavy downpour.

title: Australia elections: Who's running and why is Trump a factor
content: Australians have cast their votes in a tightly contested national election, choosing between incumbent Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and opposition leader Peter Dutton. Key issues include the rising cost of living and the impact of US tariffs. Most opinion polls in the days before the election suggested that Albanese‚Äôs Labor Party was likely to win a second term in government.

title: Int'l students in US fight back, file class-action suit against SEVIS terminations
content: International students, largely from India, are challenging ICE's policy allowing SEVIS terminations based on visa revocations, arguing it's unlawful and violates due process. The lawsuit, filed against ICE, DHS, and the Secretary of State, seeks to restore students' immigration status and strike down the new ICE policy. They claim the policy was implemented without proper procedure and exceeds ICE's authority.

title: Kohli shares official statement after liking Avneet Kaur‚Äôs photo on instagram
content: Virat Kohli‚Äôs recent social media activity unexpectedly stirred up a buzz online after fans spotted that he had liked a post from a fan page dedicated to actress Avneet Kaur. The move quickly caught people‚Äôs attention and sparked a flurry of reactions. Many of the social media users started cracking jokes and bringing up his wife, actress Anushka Sharma, in their comments.

title: Court nixes complaint against Gulmarg fashion show
content: A Srinagar court dismissed a case against designers Shivan and Narresh. The case related to an obscenity complaint about a Gulmarg fashion show. The show occurred in March during Ramadan. A complainant alleged the show hurt religious sentiments. The court stated the complaint did not meet the legal standard for obscenity.

title: How does 'Spare' royal family member earn after leaving royal fold?
content: Prince Harry's recent legal challenge regarding his UK security arrangements was unsuccessful, potentially leading to significant legal expenses. Despite this setback, his estimated net worth stands at $60 million, bolstered by inheritances from Princess Diana and the Queen Mother.

title: Railway cops could have prevented 2002 Godhra incident: HC
content: The Gujarat High Court upheld the dismissal of nine railway police constables who were assigned to patrol the Sabarmati Express on February 27, 2002. They returned to Ahmedabad early on another train, and later that day, the Sabarmati Express was torched near Godhra, killing 59. The court dismissed their reinstatement pleas, citing dereliction of duty and false entries in records.

title: Pahalgam fallout: European carriers start avoiding Pakistani airspace
content: Following Pakistan's airspace restrictions for Indian airlines, several European carriers, including Lufthansa, Air France, British Airways, and SWISS, are now avoiding Pakistani airspace. This rerouting, prompted by safety concerns and NOTAMs indicating unavailable airways, adds up to an hour to flight times for routes like Munich-Delhi and Rome-Delhi, as airlines prioritize passenger and staff safety.

title: Mika Singh reflects on ban he faced for performing in Pakistan after Uri attack
content: Mika Singh addressed the controversy surrounding his ban for performing in Pakistan after the 2016 Uri attack, highlighting perceived double standards in the industry regarding cross-border collaborations. He pointed out that while others engage in similar projects without facing backlash, he was targeted. The ban on Pakistani artists in India, triggered by terror attacks, continues to impact cultural exchanges.

title: Rahul Gandhi forced PM Modi's hand on caste census, claims Congress
content: Congress celebrates Rahul Gandhi's persistent advocacy for a caste census, claiming it forced the Modi government's hand after 11 years of resistance. The party plans to amplify its role in achieving caste enumeration through rallies and campaigns, pushing for caste quotas in private institutions and the removal of the 50% reservation cap.

title: After LNG, government may hike fertiliser imports from US
content: India is considering increasing fertiliser imports from the US to address trade imbalances and reduce reliance on countries like China and Russia. This move aligns with efforts to negotiate a trade agreement with the US, seeking better access for Indian exports in exchange for increased imports of American goods, including automobiles and farm products.

title: Open till 7pm? RBI panel calls for extending money market hours
content: An RBI panel suggests extending money market hours to 7pm, aiming to provide banks with greater flexibility in managing liquidity and accessing funds. This shift addresses the expansion and increased complexity of India's financial markets since 2019. The proposal includes adjustments to trading and settlement windows for various instruments, along with changes to the liquidity adjustment facility auction timings.

title: Raid 2 box office day 2: Ajay Devgn‚Äôs crime drama mints over Rs 11 crore
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' has made a strong start at the Indian box office, earning over Rs. 30 crore in its first two days. The film, directed by Raj Kumar Gupta, opened with Rs. 19.25 crore on Thursday, boosted by a partial holiday and franchise popularity. While Day 2 saw a drop to Rs. 11.

title: HC order reunites Pak woman with CRPF trooper husband
content: Meenal Ahmed Khan, a Pakistani national, was reunited with her CRPF trooper husband in Jammu after the J&K high court intervened to prevent her deportation. She entered India on a tourist visa and applied for a long-term visa as an Indian citizen's wife.

title: 5 Survive Bolivian Alligator-Filled Swamp For 36 Hours After Plane's Emergency Landing
content: Five people survived for 36 hours in a swamp filled with alligators after an emergency landing in the Bolivian Amazon.

title: Accused On Bail Has No Right To Seek Permission To Travel Abroad: High Court
content: Justice Subhash Vidyarthi delivered the verdict while dismissing a plea filed by Aditya Murti, a consultant at the Shri Ram Murti Smarak Institute of Medical Sciences, Bareilly.

title: How US's Central Intelligence Agency Is Trying To Recruit Chinese Officials
content: The CIA has released Mandarin videos to attract Chinese officials and young workers, aiming to tap into the increasing dissatisfaction with the countrys political system.

title: In Pahalgam Probe, 2 Terrorists Behind 2023 Rajouri Attack Questioned
content: The NIA is questioning two terrorists lodged in connection with the 2023 Rajouri attack, as the probe into the April 22 Pahalgam attack intensifies.

title: After Huge Hotel Fire, All Rooftop Restaurants In Kolkata Ordered To Shut
content: Kolkata Municipal Corporation (KMC) Mayor Firhad Hakim said all the rooftop restaurants will have to be shut down to ensure unhindered access to premises in case of an emergency.

title: Indian Astronaut's Mission Could Revolutionise Space Travel For Diabetics
content: Indian astronaut, Group Captain Shubanshu Shukla, who will fly to the International Space Station on May 29, will be conducting a key experiment on diabetes during his flight.

title: An Electric Shock, Then Sudden Rush? What Led To Deadly Stampede At Goa Temple
content: A stampede left at least six dead and dozens injured at a temple in the coastal city of Goa last night. The incident occurred during a large gathering at the Shirgaon temple.

title: Shooter Wounds Two At US College, Suspect Likely Former Employee
content: A gunman wounded two women on the campus of a private college near the US city of Los Angeles, authorities said.

title: 6 Killed, Over 50 Injured In Goa Temple Stampede, PM Modi Dials Chief Minister
content: At least six people were killed and more than 50 others injured after a stampede broke out during the annual Lairai Devi jatra (procession) at a temple in Goa's Shirgao early Saturday.

title: Trump's Next 100 Days: Now Comes The Hard Part
content: President Donald Trump spent his first 100 days issuing a blitz of executive orders to deliver rapidly on campaign pledges, drastically downsize the government and reshape America's role on the global stage.

title: What You Need To Know About Australia's Upcoming Election
content: Opinion polls indicate Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's ruling centre-left Labor party is ahead of the conservative Liberal-National coalition.

title: Human Fetus Found Hanging On Overhead Electric Wires Near UP Railway Station
content: The fetus was suspended approximately 20 feet above the ground near the Keshavpur power substation behind Platform-2 of the Sahjanwa railway station.

title: Pak Violates Ceasefire For 9th Consecutive Night, India Responds "Proportionately"
content: Pakistan Army initiated unprovoked small arms firing towards Indian posts along the Line of Control for the ninth consecutive night on Friday.

title: Pakistan UN Envoy's "Kinetic Action" By India "Imminent" Warning
content: Tension has been building up in the region following last month's terrorist attack in Pahalgam, for which The Resistance Front, a front outfit of the Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Taiba, claimed responsibility.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Pakistan Violates Ceasefire For Ninth Consecutive Time
content: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Pakistani troops continued ceasefire violations along the Line of Control (LoC) for the ninth consecutive night on Saturday.

title: "Passengers Stranded, Distressed": Supriya Sule Slams Air India For Flight Delay
content: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP-SP) MP Supriya Sule on Friday slammed Air India after her flight was delayed for over an hour at the Delhi Airport.

title: Pak Minister's X Account Blocked, Days After Military Action By India Claim
content: Pakistan Minister Ataullah Tarar had cited "credible information" to claim that India is planning a military action against its neighbour.

title: "Would Love Reconciliation With My Family," Says Prince Harry
content: Britain's Prince Harry said he would love to be reconciled with his family in an interview with the BBC on Friday.

title: IAF wants surveillance UAVs that can fly in stratosphere
content: Amidst ongoing border tensions, the Indian Air Force (IAF) is seeking to bolster its surveillance capabilities by acquiring three High-Altitude Platform System (HAPS) aircraft. These unmanned 'pseudo-satellites' will operate in the stratosphere, providing persistent intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR). The IAF has issued a request for information, aiming for delivery within 18 months.

title: Trump 1, Xi 0? US draws first blood, China signals readiness for tariff talks
content: China is considering US proposals for trade talks. This follows economic strain from US tariffs. Factory activity and exports in China have declined. Beijing signals openness to dialogue. However, it warns against coercion. Markets react positively to the news. There is hope for a thaw in the US-China trade standoff. The future of negotiations remains uncertain.

title: No more offensive remarks, Ramdev pledges in Delhi HC in sharbat case
content: Yoga guru Ramdev has assured the Delhi High Court that he will refrain from making disparaging remarks or posting similar social media content, like his "sharbat jihad" comments against Hamdard's Rooh Afza. This commitment follows a lawsuit by Hamdard, alleging Ramdev's promotion of Patanjali's Gulab Sharbat included claims that Rooh Afza's profits funded religious institutions.

title: Snakes in the backyard: How Pakistan admitted it's 'terroristan'
content: But to understand how we got there, and why it still matters in 2025, rewind a little. To a quiet garrison town called Abbottabad, where Osama bin Laden once lounged in his compound, sipping chai not far from Pakistan‚Äôs elite military academy. That scene wasn‚Äôt fiction ‚Äî it was a living embodiment of the double game Forsyth wrote about.

title: 'Itne to Virat Kohli ke paas bhi nahi honge': Vaibhav Suryavanshi hilariously trolled
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy, captivated the IPL 2025 with a record-breaking century against Gujarat Titans, leading Rajasthan Royals to a thrilling victory. However, he soon experienced the unpredictable nature of cricket with a subsequent duck against Mumbai Indians. Cricket icon Kapil Dev has advised patience in nurturing the young talent, emphasizing the need for time and careful development.

title: Saeed shielded, madrassas shut: Inside Pak's panic over Pahalgam fallout
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, India took strong actions. Pakistan fears a potential Indian strike. Security around Hafiz Saeed is heightened. Pakistani media reported false Indian incursions. Schools near the Line of Control are conducting drills. Residents are stocking supplies. Tourist spots are deserted. The US is urging de-escalation and supports India. Pakistan is bracing for possible escalation.

title: IPL 2025: Gill leads from the front as GT crush SRH
content: Shubman Gill's explosive 76 propelled Gujarat Titans to a commanding 38-run victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad. Gill's aggressive batting, supported by Sai Sudharsan and Jos Buttler, helped GT post a formidable 224/6. Prasidh Krishna's economical bowling, including the crucial wicket of Travis Head, stifled SRH's chase, despite Abhishek Sharma's valiant effort.

title: What Sullivan‚Äôs firing means for Crosby‚Äôs future in Pittsburgh Penguins
content: Mike Sullivan‚Äôs firing has left Sidney Crosby‚Äôs future with the Penguins in question. As the team enters a rebuild under Kyle Dubas, Crosby, who‚Äôs always stayed loyal to Pittsburgh, might now be at a crossroads. With a shift in direction, could the longtime captain consider leaving? This article explores how Sullivan‚Äôs departure could impact Crosby‚Äôs commitment to the team.

title: Caught on camera: Mike Waltz using less secure version of Signal app
content: Mike Waltz faces scrutiny after a photo revealed his use of TM SGNL, a modified Signal app, raising security concerns due to potential encryption compromises. The images, captured at a White House meeting, displayed conversations with high-ranking officials like JD Vance and Marco Rubio.

title: "Failure At Age Of Eating Chocolates": Tamil Nadu Minister On Big CBSE Move
content: Tamil Nadu Education Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi slammed the CBSE for failing Class V and VIII students under the National Education Policy NEP 2020.

title: Kozhikode MCH fire: Post-mortem to be conducted on bodies of 5 patients who died during blaze
content: Police register case under Section 194 of BNSS (investigation of deaths under unnatural circumstances)

title: Rakesh Tikait heckled in Muzaffarnagar during meeting to express solidarity with victims of terror attack
content: Bharatiya Kisan Union describes it as an attempt to break the unity of farmers; Naresh Tikait calls for an emergency meeting on Saturday

title: Maoist gunned down in encounter with security personnel in Chhattisgarh
content: The gunfight took place on Friday (May 2, 2025) night in a forest under the Jugad police station limits where a team of security personnel was out on an anti-Maoist operation

title: Uttar Pradesh launches WhatsApp chatbot for transport services, brings RTO functions to citizens' fingertips
content: ‚ÄúVehicle registration services, driving licence details, challan status and more can be accessed without standing in a queue at the RTO office by using the chatbot,‚Äù officials said

title: Four mid-sea attacks off T.N. coast: 14 Nagapattinam fishermen assaulted by Sri Lankan nationals, equipment looted
content: According to official sources, the attacks took place between Friday afternoon and night in the waters off the southeastern coast of Tamil Nadu

title: Karnataka sees uptick in dengue cases, reports 1,186 cases till April 30 this year
content: Six cases required hospitalisation, 51 patients are children aged below one year, and 553 are below the age of 18

title: Southern Railway to increase average speed of trains under Thiruvananthapuram division
content: Maintenance standards of main line to be adopted for loop line also. This is expected to benefit around 31 stations in the first phase

title: Assam panchayat polls: Repolling ordered in 43 booths in first phase of elections
content: Assam panchayat polls see 70.2% voter turnout in first phase, with BJP-led NDA leading uncontested in 325 seats

title: Caste census: Tejashwi writes to PM Modi, demands reservation in private sector and judiciary
content: Calling the decision historic, Mr. Yadav said that the decision to conduct the caste census can be a transformative moment in our nation‚Äôs journey towards equality.

title: Employee doesn‚Äôt have right to promotion but consideration if not disqualified: Supreme Court
content: A Bench was dealing with an appeal filed by a police constable in Tamil Nadu who was aggrieved by the denial of consideration of promotion for the sub-inspector‚Äôs post

title: Rape of Bhopal college students: Main accused shot, injured during escape bid
content: Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) Priyanka Shukla said Farhan allegedly tried to snatch a pistol from a sub-inspector, and a shot got fired from the weapon during the scuffle

title: Congress‚Äô Charanjit Channi questions surgical strikes, backtracks later
content: Former Punjab CM said the government has not taken any action even after 10 days of the Pahalgam terror attack and claimed that steps, such as annulling visas of Pakistanis and putting the Indus Waters Treaty on hold, have no meaning

title: Mild tremor hits north Gujarat; no casualty
content: The tremor, with its epicentre near Vav in Banaskantha district, was recorded at 3.35 am on May 3, 2025

title: Stampede at Goa temple: Six killed, many injured at Sree Lairai Devi temple in Shirgao, President Murmu shares her condolonces
content: State Health Minister Vishwajit Rane said at least 30 people sustained injuries, of which eight are in critical condition and two were referred to the Goa Medical College and Hospital in Bambolim

title: Vizhinjam marks the dawn of a new maritime era for India
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi boarded the ship MSC Celestinomaresca that berthed at the port. Later, he visited the key installations, including the port operations building, before the formal commissioning of the port.¬†

title: India to ask global multilateral agencies to review loans, grants to Pakistan: Source
content: The IMF Executive Board is scheduled to meet Pakistan officials on May 9 for first review of the extended funding facility, and request for an arrangement under the resilience and sustainability facility

title: Delhi High Court directs legal aid to Indians on death row in Indonesia
content: Justice Sachin Datta issues notice on the petition by the spouses of the convicted Indians and directed¬†Ministry of External Affairs to pursue the matter at the diplomatic level

title: PIL filed in HC against A.P. govt. over private party‚Äôs access to State‚Äôs Consolidated Fund
content: Claiming that the provision bypasses legislative approval and violates Articles 203, 204, and 293 of Constitution, YSRCP MLC Lella Appi Reddy moves High Court and seeks cancellation of the move

title: Kedarnath opens for devotees; over 12,000 attend grand ceremony‚Äã
content: Himalayan temple Kedarnath opens to 12,000 pilgrims with grand ceremony, adorned with flowers from different countries

title: Pahalgam terror attack: EAM Jaishankar speaks to European Union counterpart Kaja Kallas
content: European Union urges India and Pakistan to show restraint and pursue dialogue amid rising tensions over Pahalgam attack

title: Instagram accounts of Babar Azam, Rizwan and many other Pakistani cricketers blocked in India
content: Additionally, the account of Pakistan's former Prime Minister and cricket captain Imran Khan is also now inaccessible in India

title: PM Modi disappointed people of Andhra Pradesh yet again: Congress leader Shivaji
content: A.P. Congress Committee V-P criticises Prime Minister for lack of financial aid during Amaravati visit, exposing ‚Äúdouble-engine government claims‚Äù

title: Relaunch of Amaravati works marks dawn for a new Andhra, says Minister
content: ‚ÄúAmaravati is the capital of dreams. Every citizen of the State can proudly raise their head. The new capital will stand as the crowning jewel for future generations.‚Äù

title: Fire mishap near Prime Minister‚Äôs public meeting venue in Andhra Pradesh creates panic
content: Plastic pipes dumped in the open place have caught fire, and the cause of it is not known immediately, says official

title: Yet another lost-in-translation moment for PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister took a dig at the India bloc deviating from the original speech which was handed over to the the translator by the Prime Minister‚Äôs Office in advance

title: Telangana High Court dismisses criminal petition filed by retired IPS officer T. Prabhakar Rao
content: The ‚Äòabsconding officer‚Äô, whose passport had been revoked by the Union government recently, is presently hiding in United States of America.

title: NCW takes suo moto cognizance of ‚ÄòHouse Arrest‚Äô web show, warns platforms to be ‚Äòcareful‚Äô about women‚Äôs dignity
content: The NCW said it found the content to be ‚Äúdeeply disturbing‚Äù and a blatant violation of women‚Äôs consent and dignity.

title: Indian Air Force showcases aerial might as fighter jets soar over under construction Ganga Expressway
content: Hundreds of spectators present at the spot witnessed roar of engines and high-precision aerial manoeuvres with live commentary providing insights into the technical capabilities and strategic roles of each aircraft.

title: ¬†Pakistan continuing its campaign of ‚Äòstate sponsored terror‚Äô in Balochistan: Assam CM
content: Systematic extrajudicial killings in Balochistan ‚Äî commonly known as ‚Äòkill and dump‚Äô¬†‚Äî remain one of the darkest chapters in Pakistan‚Äôs human rights record

title: Indian bureaucracy is one of the finest in the world, says Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman was speaking at a function organised by the Shankar IAS Academy to felicitate the candidates who emerged successful in the Union Public Service Commission‚Äôs (UPSC‚Äôs) civil services examination, 2024

title: Smoke engulfs Kozhikode MCH casualty, patients evacuated
content: The initial assessment of the fire services is that a short circuit might have caused the fire. Health Minister Veena George has ordered an inquiry into the incident.

title: BBMP reports 68 fallen trees¬†as rains continue in Bengaluru
content: BBMP Chief Commissioner M. Maheshwar Rao visited the civic body‚Äôs control room and the Integrated Command and Control Centre (ICCC) on Friday evening.

title: Trinamool MP Yusuf Pathan seeks Home Minister‚Äôs intervention over alleged assault on migrant workers from Bengal in Odisha
content: Mr. Pathan wrote in the letter addressed to the Home Minister that the systematic targeting of workers from West Bengal, based on their regional identity, especially for those from the Muslim community is deeply troubling.

title: VHP condemns attacks on Kashmiris, but says they will not stop those speaking against ‚Äòjihad‚Äô
content: Pahalgam attack makes it clear that terror has a religion, says VHP chief; citing an incident from the Ramayana, Mr. Kumar says India may be awaiting the right opportunity to ‚Äúretaliate‚Äù against the attack

title: The Hindu Huddle: Can ethics keep pace with the rapid evolution of AI?
content: AI can be used for surveillance, for generating deepfakes, and for spreading disinformation ‚Äî all areas already rife with ethical concerns; these are some of the questions that will be discussed during The Hindu Huddle session titled ‚ÄòAI for all? The dream of a democratised and ethical technology‚Äô to be moderated by author Manu Joseph

title: AIADMK‚Äôs executive committee ratifies the party‚Äôs alliance with BJP
content: Expressing its wish that the coalition would become a ‚Äúvictorious alliance‚Äù, the committee said a front was being formed by like-minded parties to defeat the ‚Äúcommon adversary‚Äù ‚Äî the¬†Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam ‚Äî by ensuring that¬†anti-DMK¬†votes did not get split

title: Erstwhile Visakhapatnam poised to be India‚Äôs largest steel-producing district
content: With the Centre‚Äôs bailout package and other efforts being put in to restore Visakhapatnam Steel Plant to its full production capacity, and ArcelorMittal preparing to set up its unit in Anakapalli district, the potential combined production capacity could be a record 25.10 MPTA, the largest in any district in India, and that their products are complementary is the icing on the cake

title: Calcutta HC tells Police Commissioner to file report on attack on lawyers, issues contempt notices to eight protestors
content: The three-judge Bench also directed the police chief to ensure protection to members of the legal profession and prevent such incidents from recurring

title: Pakistan armed forces hold a series of exercises
content: The armed forces have launched military exercises near the Line of Control and in Arabian Sea, showcasing advanced weaponry; several air traffic routes between Lahore and Islamabad closed

title: Teach Pakistan a lesson for Pahalgam, says Congress Working Committee
content: This is a time for demonstrating our collective will as a nation to teach Pakistan a lesson and curb terrorism decisively, says the CWC

title: India set to become MICE tourism capital of the world, says Union Culture Minister
content: The government and private exhibition industry must collaborate to establish India as a centre of MICE tourism, says Gajendra Singh Shekhawat

title: Supreme Court orders return of Ph.D. scholar Ramadas to TISS
content: A Bench headed by Justice Dipankar Datta gave relief to Mr. Ramadas, who had challenged his suspension and ban from entering any TISS campus.

title: Odisha govt. orders probe into Puri Jagannath priests‚Äô role in West Bengal temple ceremony
content: The probe will also find out if leftover timber procured for the Nabakalebara rituals at the Puri Jagannath Temple in Odisha was used to carve the idols of the sibling deities at a new Jagannath temple complex in Digha, West Bengal

title: Districts outshine Kolkata, boys outperform girls in Bengal Class 10 board exams
content: Even though more female students appeared in this year‚Äôs Class 10 exams, girls recorded a lower success rate than boys.

title: Activists seek restoration of flagship schemes, focus on health infrastructure
content: The JSA, functioning as the Rajasthan chapter of the People‚Äôs Health Movement and supported by a coalition of 70 networks and organisations, has submitted a memorandum to Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma

title: Caste census will improve opportunities for the needy: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Union Finance Minister says the DMK should not seek political mileage from the census, which will provide data necessary to create opportunities for the less privileged

title: Maharashtra Congress chief criticises State government‚Äôs 100-day report card, points to internal rift in Mahayuti
content: Mr. Sapkal claims that CM Fadnavis used the report card to highlight the superior performance of departments under his direct control, while downplaying the efforts of those managed by alliance partners ‚Äî Shiv Sena and NCP

title: Vizhinjam Port economy to drive India‚Äôs growth to new heights: PM Modi
content: PM praises role of private sector in the port sector, commissions India‚Äôs first dedicated container transshipment port, built through a PPP between Kerala‚Äôs Communist government and an Adani company

title: ITBP team scales Mt. Makalu, fifth highest peak in the world
content: Led by Deputy Commandant Anoop Kumar Negi, and Nihas Suresh as Deputy Leader, the 12-member team was divided into two groups of six climbers each

title: Kashmiris being unfairly targeted in massive crackdown, families being torn apart: Mirwaiz
content: The events that unfolded after the horrendous Pahalgam incident have again shown that whenever such things happen it is the people of Kashmir who bear the brunt and suffer

title: Kolkata Mayor asks to close down all rooftop restaurants in city, three days after a massive blaze claimed 14 lives
content: This comes as another massive fire engulfed a factory in Kolkata on Friday, only a couple of days after the Rituraj Hotel fire which has led to 14 deaths.

title: SCR General Manager inspects Vijayawada, Gunadala railway stations
content: Arun Kumar Jain checks passenger amenities, safety aspects and ongoing works, besides interacting with the staff

title: Manipur ethnic conflict: Security heightened ahead of second anniversary
content: Kuki-Zo organisations will observe May 3 as ‚ÄòSeparation Day‚Äô with students groups calling for a shutdown; an umbrella body of Meitei organisations will organise a people‚Äôs convention to mark the day

title: Baba Ramdev gives undertaking to Delhi High Court on controversial video against rival brand
content: Hamdard National Foundation India filed a plea against Ramdev and his Patanjali Foods Ltd over the controversial remarks

title: Tight security for¬†Hyderabad Miss World events
content: Additional DGP for Law and Order, ADGP for Greyhounds and Octopus and senior police officers from various branches¬†coordinating security measures; centralised control system to be set up to oversee operations across Telangana

title: WAVES Declaration adopted to promote cultural pluralism and responsible media innovation
content: Member nations at Global Media Dialogue 2025 agree to uphold ethical use of emerging technologies, foster global collaborations, and bridge the digital divide through inclusive media practices

title: Drugs worth ‚Çπ547 crore seized, 15 arrested: MHA
content: Bharat is axing down drug cartels with ruthless aggression. The Amritsar Zonal Unit of the NCB axed a drug diversion cartel through a 4-month-long operation across 4 states, says Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Southern Railway to upgrade e-vehicle charging facilities and install new ones at several stations across Chennai
content: As part of the initiative, 28 railway stations have been chosen to get the facilities; among these work has already commenced at Light House, Thirumayilai, Velachery, and Kotturpuram

title: Official says half of looted police weapons recovered in Manipur, most during President‚Äôs rule
content: Sit-in protests, demonstrations allowed on second anniversary of conflict, but no rallies; of the 6,020 weapons looted from police armouries, 3,000 have been recovered, including 1,750 recovered after President‚Äôs Rule, says official

title: Licensed stamp vendors are public servants under anti-corruption law: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court agreed with the High Court‚Äôs finding that stamp vendors were public servants but set aside the conviction of stamp vendor Aman Bhatia on the ground that the prosecution did not prove the allegation beyond reasonable doubt.

title: Uttarakhand HC pulls up local administration for ordering ‚Äòillegal‚Äô demolition of house of rape accused
content: The civic body has ordered demolition of the house of the senior citizen accused of raping a 12-year-old that lead to communal tension in the hill town

title: One killed, 6 injured as ambulance rams into vehicles, pedestrians
content: The driver lost control of the vehicle and hit two pushcarts,¬†an autorickshaw, a scooter, and some pedestrians on BTS Road

title: The disasterpiece that changed everything for Astros ace Hunter Brown
content: ugliest pitcher in major league baseball history came a little more than a year ago . right-hander for the Houston Astros with a high-octane fastball and an array of off-speed pitches . he yielded 11 hits, the most ever for a start of less than one inning .

title: Western Conference playoffs: Rockets dominate in Game 6
content: the 2024-25 playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . on friday, the no. 5 LA Clippers forced a Game 7 against the No. 4 Denver Nuggets in front of their home crowd . the winner of the series will take on the Timberwolves .

title: Wetzel: Never mind the girlfriend kerfuffle. Belichick will always be fine.
content: belichick is arguably the greatest coach in the history of the sport . his jump to the college ranks and the University of North Carolina is of great intrigue . he's running point on publicity for his new book, "The Art of Winning: Lessons from My Life in Football"

title: Time for Ryan Garcia and Devin Haney to move on from each other -- for now
content: a rematch between Ryan Garcia and Devin Haney was one of the most anticipated fights of 2025 . they were placed in separate bouts against the unique setting of Times Square . a plan hatched by Saudi Arabia's chairman of the general entertainment authority ended up becoming an utter disaster .

title: Master Global Healthcare Leadership with XLRI
content: the healthcare sector is undergoing a significant transformation, driven by technological advancements, regulatory shifts, and evolving patient expectations . once valued at $280 billion in 2020, India‚Äôs healthcare market is projected to reach $638 billion by 2025, fueled by AI-driven diagnostics, telemedicine, and digital health records1 .

title: Grand Theft Auto VI release date revealed
content: "we are very sorry that this is later than you expected," developer says . "the interest and excitement surrounding a new Grand Theft Auto has been truly humbling for our entire team," developer said . the next iteration of rockstar's urban crime role-playing game is one of the most hotly anticipated video games of all time .

title: Five rookies with breakout potential
content: the WNBA is a hard league to break into, but rookies are making an impact earlier than ever . in 2023, I recommended not drafting any rookies that weren't the overall no. 1 pick, Aliyah Boston . the 2024 draft class was an outlier from previous history; all four lottery picks averaged over 20 fantasy points per game .

title: Where does Bo Nickal rank among MMA's undefeated fighters?
content: a select few undefeated fighters in professional MMA stand out from the pack . unbeaten fighters like Bo Nickal and Michael Morales are still rising prospects . morales faces Gilbert Burns in the main event at UFC Fight Night on sunday .

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Sandhagen gets past Figueiredo at UFC Fight Night
content: cory Sandhagen takes on former men's flyweight champion deiveson Figueiredo in main event at UFC Fight Night in Des Moines, Iowa . the bantamweight contender is aiming to bounce back from his first loss since 2023 . he was riding a three-fight win streak before dropping that fight .

title: What must Liverpool address in summer transfer window?
content: Virgil van Dijk, Mohamed Salah and Trent Alexander-Arnold would have to face tough negotiations with three of their top players . the trio won the premier league by a sizeable margin, two of the big free agents extended the league . they'd have to do it off the back of ¬£57 million in losses .
